lines.text: Vicky, never marry a woman whose had any connection with the stage no matter how much you love her.
I love Helen. Why can't she be like other wives and be content to stay home? You know, sit or... or sew, or what other wives do. I want a wife who is a wife, not a public exhibition.
We understand each other now, don't we, dear?
Yes. Love conquers all I suppose.
Then there is no further question about the singing?
None whatever. We're never going to mention it again. The way I feel about it is just because Helen was in a little act that played a few weeks...
38 straight weeks, my sweetheart...
Eight or nine years ago...
Five years ago, my precious. Exactly five...
Oh, it was more than that, darling...
Five, my wonder man. We've been married four and it was the year before that.

It's no wonder wives get restless and lonely. Love isn't everything, you should know that. Wives like to be looked at once in a while and thought of. Yes, even admired. But husbands won't do it and other men musn't.

[to Helen]
In the eternal warfare between male and female, I flatter myself that, right or wrong, I've always been a hundred percent woman. Get packing!
Madame says she will see you in exactly one hour, sir.
In an hour?
Yes, sir.
Did you tell her I had orchids?
Yes, sir.
And she was unmoved by orchids?
Apparently, sir.
Oh, this woman is going to be very difficult.
What worries me is I never thought of Doug as a... as a...
I believe the technical term is "chaser".
You know, Morris, there isn't a woman in the world who wouldn't give all she had to be in my shoes tonight. To be able to catch your own husband without his knowing it.
I could hae used some of that once or twice myself.
To see how he act, how he thinks, what he does with another woman.
There's no doubt about it, this is your night!
Well, I've seen some queer things in my time, but this is my first view of a two-sided triangle.

[Disguised as Raquel with a French accent]
Tell me, what eez she like, zees wife of yours?
Uh, Helen is a very good sport.
Oh, what a terrible thing to say about any woman... a good sport. How cruel an American husband can be when he do not love hees wife.
I'm sorry.

[Probing]
You don't love her, do you? Do you?
You know, you're giving me a very strange feeling.
I mean to.
The feeling is that maybe you shouldn't have come here.
Oh, because I make you theenk of her, yes?
Yes.

[Softly to herself]
Good.
Helen, you don't suppose for one minute that I didn't know it was you all the time.
Oh, you liar.
